definition: (of an occasion) requiring formal clothes, clothing in general, arrange attractively
details:
adjective
- (of an occasion) requiring formal clothes
= example: (of an occasion) requiring formal clothes
= synonyms: full-dress
- suitable for formal occasions
= synonyms: full-dress
noun
- clothing in general
= synonyms: apparel, wearing apparel, clothes
- clothing of a distinctive style or for a particular occasion
= synonyms: garb, attire
- a one-piece garment for a woman
= synonyms: frock
verb
- arrange attractively
= example: arrange attractively
= synonyms: set, coif, coiffure, do, arrange, coiffe
- dress or groom with elaborate care
= example: dress or groom with elaborate care
= synonyms: plume
- to attire with clothing in a certain manner
= example: to attire with clothing in a certain manner
= synonyms: dress up
- give a neat appearance to
= synonyms: curry, groom
- put on clothes
= example: put on clothes
= synonyms: get dressed
- provide with clothes or put clothes on
= example: provide with clothes or put clothes on
= synonyms: apparel
- apply a bandage or medication to
= example: apply a bandage or medication to
- convert into leather
= example: convert into leather
- kill and prepare for market or consumption
= example: kill and prepare for market or consumption
= synonyms: dress out
- cut down rough-hewn (lumber) to standard thickness and width
- put a finish on
= example: put a finish on
- cultivate, tend, and cut back the growth of
= example: cultivate, tend, and cut back the growth of
= synonyms: clip
- put a dressing on
= example: put a dressing on
- provide with decoration
= example: provide with decoration
= synonyms: decorate
- decorate (food), as with parsley or other ornamental foods
= synonyms: trim
- arrange in ranks
= example: arrange in ranks
= synonyms: line up
